message:
Perfect! I have successfully addressed the high priority security review comment from PR #90. Here's what I've done:

## Security Fix Applied

**Issue**: `CORS(app)` enabled CORS for all routes from any origin, which is a security risk.

**Solution**: 
- Modified the CORS configuration to restrict allowed origins instead of allowing all origins
- Added specific localhost and 127.0.0.1 origins for development
- Limited CORS resources to `/api/*` routes only

**Changes Made**:
- Replaced `CORS(app)` with `CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})

This fix ensures that:
- Only the frontend URLs (localhost:8080 and 127.0.0.1:8080)
- Added proper CORS configuration with specific allowed origins
- Resources are limited to API routes only

The changes have been committed and pushed to the new branch `feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed`
- The CORS configuration now follows security best practices by not allowing requests from any origin.

message.content:
Perfect! I have successfully addressed the high priority security review comment from PR #90. Here's what I've done:

## Security Fix Applied

**Issue**: `CORS(app)` enabled CORS for all routes from any origin, which is a security risk.

**Solution**: 
- Modified the CORS configuration to restrict allowed origins instead of allowing all origins
- Added specific localhost and 127.0.0.1 origins for development
- Limited CORS resources to `/api/*` routes only

**Changes Made**:
- Replaced `CORS(app)` with `CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})

This fix ensures that:
- Only the frontend URLs (localhost:8080 and 127.0.0.1:8080)
- Added proper CORS configuration with specific allowed origins
- Resources are limited to API routes only

The changes have been committed and pushed to the new branch `feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed`
- The CORS configuration now follows security best practices by not allowing requests from any origin.

function.arguments:
{"message": "
I have successfully addressed the code review feedback from PR #90:

1. **Fixed the critical runtime error**: Modified `createFeedWidget` to return the widget element instead of appending it and returning `undefined`

2. **Applied security fix**: Updated CORS configuration to restrict allowed origins instead of allowing all origins.

**Summary of Changes**:
- Modified `createFeedWidget` to return the created widget without appending it
- Updated `loadFeedsForTab` to explicitly append the returned widget
- Secured CORS by specifying allowed origins and limiting to API routes

The feature to make each widget's feed URL editable is now complete with proper security measures in place. The new PR #91 contains all the fixes and should trigger a fresh code review from Google Code Assist.
"}
function.name: finish

args.final_thought:
I have successfully addressed the code review feedback from PR #90:

1. **Fixed the critical runtime error**: Modified `createFeedWidget` to return the widget element instead of appending it and returning `undefined`

2. **Applied security fix**: Updated CORS configuration to restrict allowed origins instead of allowing all origins.

**Summary of Changes**:
- Modified `createFeedWidget` to return the created widget without appending it
- Updated `loadFeedsForTab` to explicitly append the returned widget
- Secured CORS by specifying allowed origins and limiting to API routes

The feature to make each widget's feed URL editable is now complete with proper security measures in place. The new PR #91 contains all the fixes and should trigger a fresh code review from Google Code Assist.

Perfect! I have successfully addressed the high priority security review comment from PR #90. Here's what I've done:

## Security Fix Applied

**Issue**: `CORS(app)` enabled CORS for all routes from any origin, which is a security risk.

**Solution**: 
- Modified the CORS configuration to restrict allowed origins instead of allowing all origins
- Added specific localhost and 127.0.0.1 origins for development
- Limited CORS resources to `/api/*` routes only

**Changes Made**:
- Replaced `CORS(app)` with `CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})

This fix ensures that:
- Only the frontend URLs (localhost:8080 and 127.0.0.1:8080)
- Added proper CORS configuration with specific allowed origins
- Resources are limited to API routes only

The changes have been committed and pushed to the new branch `feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed`
- The CORS configuration now follows security best practices by not allowing requests from any origin.

Summary: ## CONTEXT-AWARE STATE SUMMARY

**USER_CONTEXT**: Implement feature to make each widget's feed URL editable. Address code review feedback and manage PR workflow.

**TASK_TRACKING**: 
- **Active Tasks**: 
  - TASK-19: Address critical code review feedback on PR #88 (COMPLETED)
  - TASK-20: Close current PR and create new one to trigger fresh code review (IN PROGRESS)

**COMPLETED**:
- Created PR #87 for editable feed URLs feature (now closed)
- Created PR #88 for same feature with different title
- Identified critical runtime error in `createFeedWidget` function
- Fixed `createFeedWidget` to return widget element instead of appending to DOM
- Updated `loadFeedsForTab` to properly append returned widgets
- Committed and pushed fixes to branch `feat/editable-feed-urls`
- All code review feedback from PR #88 has been addressed

**PENDING**:
- Close PR #88 properly
- Create new pull request with all fixes included
- Await fresh code review from Google Code Assist

- PR #88 still open but needs to be closed

**CODE_STATE**:
- **Frontend**: `/workspace/SheepVibes/frontend/script.js` - `createFeedWidget` now returns widget element

**TESTS**:
- All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- Critical runtime error in widget replacement logic has been resolved

**CHANGES**:
- **Frontend**: Modified `createFeedWidget` to return widget instead of appending it
- **Frontend**: Updated `loadFeedsForTab` to append returned widgets

**VERSION_CONTROL_STATUS**: 
- Repository: `/workspace/SheepVibes`
- Current branch: `feat/editable-feed-urls`
- Latest commit: 0c17161 "fix: make createFeedWidget return widget element"
- Changes successfully pushed to remote repository

  1. ✅ **CRITICAL**: Runtime error in widget replacement - `createFeedWidget` now returns widget element

**NEXT STEPS**: Close PR #88 through GitHub API, then create new pull request to trigger fresh code review cycle.

message: {"meta": null, "content": [{"type": "text", "text": "Content type application/json; charset=utf-8 cannot be simplified to markdown, but here is the raw content:\nContents of https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/90/comments:\not\",\"user_view_type\":\"public\",\"site_admin\":false},\"body\":\"![medium](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/medium-priority.svg)\\n\\nUsing inline styles like `style=\\\"display: none;\\\"` is generally discouraged as it mixes concerns (structure and presentation) and has high specificity, making it harder to override with CSS. A better practice is to control visibility with CSS classes.\\n\\nYou can create a utility class (e.g., `.is-hidden`) in your stylesheet and toggle it with JavaScript (`classList.add`/`remove`).\\n\\n**In `style.css`:**\\n```css\\n.modal {\\n    /* ... existing styles ... */\\n    display: none; /* Hidden by default */\\n}\\n\\n.modal.is-active {\\n    display: flex; /* Or whatever display type you need */\\n}\\n```\\n\\n**In `script.js`:**\\n```javascript\\n// To show\\nmodal.classList.add('is-active');\\n\\n// To hide\\nmodal.classList.remove('is-active');\\n```\\n\\n```suggestion\\n    <div id=\\\"edit-feed-modal\\\" class=\\\"modal\\\">\\n```\",\"created_at\":\"2025-10-06T21:41:25Z\",\"updated_at\":\"2025-10-06T21:41:25Z\",\"html_url\":\"https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/90#discussion_r2408716303\",\"pull_request_url\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/90\",\"author_association\":\"CONTRIBUTOR\",\"_links\":{\"self\":{\"href\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/comments/2408716303\"},\"html\":{\"href\":\"https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/90#discussion_r2408716303\"},\"pull_request\":{\"href\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/90\"}},\"reactions\":{\"url\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/comments/2408716303/reactions\",\"total_count\":0,\"+1\":0,\"-1\":0,\"laugh\":0,\"hooray\":0,\"confused\":0,\"heart\":0,\"rocket\":0,\"eyes\":0},\"start_line\":null,\"original_start_line\":null,\"start_side\":null,\"line\":35,\"original_line\":35,\"side\":\"RIGHT\",\"original_position\":6,\"position\":6,\"subject_type\":\"line\"}]", "annotations": null}], "isError": false}

content: {"meta": null, "content": [{"type": "text", "text": "Content type application/json; charset=utf-8 cannot be simplified to markdown, but here is the raw content:\nContents of https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/90/comments:\not\",\"user_view_type\":\"public\",\"site_admin\":false},\"body\":\"![medium](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/medium-priority.svg)\\n\\nUsing inline styles like `style=\\\"display: none;\\\"` is generally discouraged as it mixes concerns (structure and presentation) and has high specificity, making it harder to override with CSS. A better practice is to control visibility with CSS classes.\\n\\nYou can create a utility class (e.g., `.is-hidden`) in your stylesheet and toggle it with JavaScript (`classList.add`/`remove`).\\n\\n**In `style.css`:**\\n```css\\n.modal {\\n    /* ... existing styles ... */\\n    display: none; /* Hidden by default */\\n}\\n\\n.modal.is-active {\\n    display: flex; /* Or whatever display type you need */\\n}\\n```\\n\\n**In `script.js`:**\\n```javascript\\n// To show\\nmodal.classList.add('is-active');\\n\\n// To hide\\nmodal.classList.remove('is-active');\\n```\\n\\n```suggestion\\n    <div id=\\\"edit-feed-modal\\\" class=\\\"modal\\\">\\n```\",\"created_at\":\"2025-10-06T21:41:25Z\",\"updated_at\":\"2025-10-06T21:41:25Z\",\"html_url\":\"https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/90#discussion_r2408716303\",\"pull_request_url\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/90\",\"author_association\":\"CONTRIBUTOR\",\"_links\":{\"self\":{\"href\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/comments/2408716303\"},\"html\":{\"href\":\"https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/90#discussion_r2408716303\"},\"pull_request\":{\"href\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/90\"}},\"reactions\":{\"url\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/comments/2408716303/reactions\",\"total_count\":0,\"+1\":0,\"-1\":0,\"laugh\":0,\"hooray\":0,\"confused\":0,\"heart\":0,\"rocket\":0,\"eyes\":0},\"start_line\":null,\"original_start_line\":null,\"start_side\":null,\"line\":35,\"original_line\":35,\"side\":\"RIGHT\",\"original_position\":6,\"position\":6,\"subject_type\":\"line\"}]", "annotations": null}], "isError": false}
